summary: This document is an email chain from April 2020 discussing efforts to find a trauma therapist for a victim of Jeffrey Epstein, who was abused from 2003-2008. The correspondence involves attorneys and a victim services coordinator arranging therapy and dealing with a claim through the Office of Victim Services (OVS).

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: Attorney at Edwards Pottinger LLC who is assisting an Epstein victim with therapy referrals and OVS claim coordination. She confirms the victim was abused by Jeffrey Epstein from 2003-2008.

persons.name: Shari Eliot
persons.context: A therapist referred to work with the Epstein survivor, agreed to accept OVS reimbursement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the perpetrator who abused the victim from 2003-2008.

connections.description: Henderson is an attorney representing a victim of Epstein, confirming the abuse period.
Henderson's colleague refers the victim to therapist Shari Eliot for trauma treatment.

events.title: Period of abuse by Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: A victim was abused by Jeffrey Epstein over this five-year period.

events.title: FBI voicemail left
events.description: The FBI left a voicemail regarding the victim's case, as noted in the OVS claim process.

events.title: Therapy referral coordination
events.description: Email chain shows ongoing coordination to secure a trauma therapist for an Epstein victim using OVS funding.

keyFacts: A victim was abused by Jeffrey Epstein from 2003 to 2008, as confirmed by attorney Brittany Henderson.
The victim was seeking trauma therapy and required a therapist who would accept reimbursement directly from the Office of Victim Services (OVS).
Attorney Brittany Henderson and colleagues were actively coordinating therapy referrals and OVS claim logistics for the victim in early 2020.
The FBI was involved in the case, with a voicemail left on March 6, 2020, as part of the OVS claim process.
Therapist Shari Eliot was identified as a referral who agreed to accept OVS reimbursement for treating the Epstein survivor.
